title: Butterflies and Moths
description: Butterflies and Moths outlines the difference between butterflies and moths. Students learn about the body parts, life cycle, and behavior of each type of insect. Photographs and charts complement the learning experience.
meta: antennae, caterpillars, chrysalis, cocoon, exoskeleton, insects, invertebrates, larval, life cycle, metamorphosis, migrate, molting, predators, pupal, species
Use the reading strategy of asking and answering questions to make sense of text
Compare and Contrast : Find details to compare and contrast butterflies and moths
Antonyms : Identify antonyms for content vocabulary
Alphabetical Order : Alphabetize and define content vocabulary

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
